citing_paper_authors: Wen, Wang | John, Auer | Ram, Parasuraman | Irine, Zubarev | David, Brandyberry | Mary P., Harper
raw_text: The Deep Read reading comprehension prototype system (Hirschman et al, 1999) achieves a level of 36% of the answers correct using a bag-of-words approach together with limited linguistic processing
clean_text: The Deep Read reading comprehension prototype system (Hirschman et al, 1999) achieves a level of 36% of the answers correct using a bag-of-words approach together with limited linguistic processing.

citing_paper_authors: Yongping, Du | Helen M., Meng | Xuanjing, Huang | Lide, Wu
raw_text: The RC task was first proposed by the MITRE Corporation which developed the Deep Read reading comprehension system (Hirschman et al, 1999)
clean_text: The RC task was first proposed by the MITRE Corporation which developed the Deep Read reading comprehension system (Hirschman et al, 1999).

citing_paper_authors: Yongping, Du | Helen M., Meng | Xuanjing, Huang | Lide, Wu
raw_text: (Hirschman et al 1999) reported a HumSent accuracy of 36.6% on the Remedia test set
clean_text: (Hirschman et al 1999) reported a HumSent accuracy of 36.6% on the Remedia test set.

raw_text: The Deep Read reading comprehension system (Hirschman et al, 1999) uses a statistical bag-of words approach, matching the question with the lexically most similar sentence in the story
clean_text: The Deep Read reading comprehension system (Hirschman et al, 1999) uses a statistical bag-of-words approach, matching the question with the lexically most similar sentence in the story.

citing_paper_authors: Iddo, Lev | Bill, MacCartney | Christopher D., Manning | Roger, Levy
raw_text: in the sense of (Hirschman et al, 1999): puzzle texts were developed with a goal independent of the evaluation of natural language processing systems, and so provide a more realistic evaluation framework than specially-designed tests such as TREC QA
clean_text: Moreover, the domain is another example of "found test material" in the sense of (Hirschman et al, 1999): puzzle texts were developed with a goal independent of the evaluation of natural language processing systems, and so provide a more realistic evaluation framework than specially-designed tests such as TREC QA.

raw_text: We call this set the MITRE corpus (Hirschman et al, 1999)
clean_text: We call this set the MITRE corpus (Hirschman et al, 1999).

citing_paper_authors: Kui, Xu | Helen M., Meng | Fuliang, Weng
raw_text: We used the Remedia corpus (Hirschman et al, 1999) and ChungHwa corpus (Xu and Meng, 2005) in our experiments
clean_text: We used the Remedia corpus (Hirschman et al, 1999) and ChungHwa corpus (Xu and Meng, 2005) in our experiments.
